statalign.base
Class MainManager

java.lang.Object
  statalign.base.MainManager

public class MainManager
extends java.lang.Object

This is the central class in the information flow amongst classes. This class also manages the main thread that runs the MCMC.

Author:
miklos, novak

Field Summary
 java.lang.String[] alignmentTypes
          The types of alignments in which StatAlign can generate output alignments Implemented types currently are StatAlign (our own format), Clustal, Fasta, Phylip, Nexus
 int currentAlignmentType
          This integer stores the index of the current alignment type, as it is in alignmenttypes
 java.lang.String filename
           
 MainFrame frame
          The main window of our program.
 InputGUI inputgui
          The graphical interface of the Input panel
 SubstitutionModel model
          The curent substitution model that is used to analyze the sequences.
 MCMCPars pars
          This class stores the parameters (number of burn-in cycles, number of steps, number of samplings) of the MCMC
 PostprocessManager postProcMan
          This is the postprocess-manager of our program, which handles the postprocesses applied on the MCMC run.
 RawSequences seqs
          The loaded sequences are stored in the RowSequences class
 MainThread thread
          The name of the input file from which we read the sequences.
 
Constructor Summary
MainManager(MainFrame frame)
          A trivial constructor that sets only MainFrame The MainFrame creates its MainManager, and the MainManager knows who is its owner MainFrame, so it can access GUIs on the MainFrame
 
Method Summary
 void finished()
          It terminates the MCMC thread, handling properly the thread management.
 void start()
          This function starts a new MCMC run.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Constructor Detail

MainManager

public MainManager(MainFrame frame)
A trivial constructor that sets only MainFrame The MainFrame creates its MainManager, and the MainManager knows who is its owner MainFrame, so it can access GUIs on the MainFrame

Parameters:
frame - The owner of the MainManager, the main window of the graphical interface.
Method Detail

start

public void start()
This function starts a new MCMC run. It asks files for writing outputs, and it launches a MainThread that handles the MCMC run.

finished

public void finished()
It terminates the MCMC thread, handling properly the thread management.
